definition: to make a draft/to draft (a document)

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

sentences.english: If you are using a pen, try this exercise without first doing any drawing with a pencil.
sentences.chinese: 如果你正使用鋼筆，那就試下先不用鉛筆來起稿。

sentences.english: Draft the townhouse on watercolor paper with pencil.
sentences.chinese: 首先用鉛筆輕力在水彩紙上起稿。

definition: rough sketch (of a painting)/(of an official) to approve a document by signing it
to copy (a model of calligraphy or painting etc)
inked line/carpenter's straight line marker (an inked cord stretched tight then lowered onto timber)
to draw a rectangular grid (e.g. of farmland)/to checker
to color (a picture etc)/to dye (fabric etc)/to stain (furniture etc)
gongbi, traditional Chinese painting method characterized by meticulous brush technique and detailed description
to draw/picture/painting/CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1]/classifier for paintings etc/variant of 劃|划[hua4]
